New Records: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left
Lillard’s 10 3-pointers were his most since joining the Bucks last season
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left
Lillard had put Milwaukee ahead by hitting a step-back jumper with 9.8 seconds remaining

Cleveland called timeout. Evan Mobley inbounded a pass to Mitchell, who caught it while barely avoiding a backcourt violation. Mitchell briefly lost control of the ball, but regained possession in 3-point range, dribbled inside the arc and hit a 19-footer
Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee has lost five straight since winning its opener
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who hasn’t yet made his season debut as he recovers from surgery on his ankles
Post-Match Reflections: The Bucks need more from Gary Trent Jr., who scored three points in 34 minutes
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee wasted a brilliant performance from Damian Lillard, who had 41 points with nine assists and shot 10 of 15 from 3-point range
Giannis Antetokounmpo had 34 points, 16 rebounds and nine assists for the Bucks
The Cavaliers improved to 7-0 and are one win away from matching their best start in franchise history
